N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. II, Forms (cf. Part 110), form A-1 - Application and order to authorize confinement for additional period

State Regulations
FORM A-1
APPLICATION AND ORDER TO
AUTHORIZE CONFINEMENT FOR
ADDITIONAL PERIOD
STATE OF NEW YORK
SUPREME COURT COUNTY COURT
PART: ________ COUNTY: ____________
________
PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK
vs. Indictment No. ____________
________
Defendant
________
(1)

The undersigned is authorized by
the State Commissioner of Mental Health to submit this application for and on
behalf of the said Commissioner to the court pursuant to subdivision 4 of C PL
330.20 for an order authorizing temporary confinement of the above-named
defendant for an additional period of 30 days to complete the psychiatric
examination of the said defendant as directed by this court in a previously
issued examination order. (2)

This court issued an examination
order on [date] ________ directing that the above-named defendant submit to a
psychiatric examination to determine whether the said defendant has a dangerous
mental disorder, or if he she does not have a dangerous mental disorder, whether the said defendant is mentally ill. (3)

The examination order referred to
in paragraph (2) of this application directed that the above-named defendant be
confined in a secure facility for a period not exceeding 30 days. (4)

Pursuant to the
examination order referred to in paragraph (2) of this application, the
above-named defendant is confined in the following secure facility of the State

Office of Mental Health: ____________
____________. (5)

The above-named defendant
was received at the secure facility referred to in paragraph (4) of this
application on [date] ________. (6)

The psychiatric examiners
designated by the Commissioner of Mental Health pursuant to the examination
order referred to in paragraph (2) of this application have commenced their
examination of the above-named defendant. The 30-day period referred to in the
said examination order expires on [date] ________. (7)

The undersigned is of the
view that the psychiatric examination of the above-named defendant will not be
completed prior to the expiration of the period referred to in paragraph (6) of
this application, and that a longer period will be necessary to complete the
aforesaid examination for the following reasons: ____________
____________
____________. (8)

Written notice of this
application has been given to the above-named defendant, counsel for the
defendant, the Mental Health Information Service and the District Attorney. This written notice was given at least five (5) days prior to the date that
this application will be submitted to the court. (9)

No previous application
for the relief sought herein has been made. WHEREFORE, the undersigned respectfully
requests that this application be granted and that the court issue an order
pursuant to subdivision 4 of C PL 330.20 authorizing confinement of the
above-named defendant in the aforesaid secure facility, pursuant to the
previously issued examination order, for an addition period of ________ (not
exceeding 30 days). ______________

[Time] ________
ORDER
________
PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK
vs. ________
Defendant
________
Present: Honorable ____________
Justice of the Supreme Court

Judge of the County Court

This court having issued an examination
order on [date] ________ directing that the above-named defendant submit to a
psychiatric examination to determine whether the said defendant has a dangerous
mental disorder, of if he she does not have a dangerous mental disorder, whether the said defendant is mentally ill, And, the aforesaid examination order
directing that the above-named defendant be confined in a secure facility for a
period not exceeding 30 days, And, the psychiatric examiners designated by
the Commissioner of Mental Health pursuant to the aforesaid examination order
having commenced their examination of the above-named defendant, And, the 30-day period referred to in the
aforesaid examination order expiring on [date] ________, And, an application having been made by the

Commissioner of Mental Health for an order authorizing confinement of the
above-named defendant, pursuant to the aforesaid examination order, for an
additional period not exceeding 30 days, And, due deliberation thereon having been
had, And, the court having found that a longer
period is necessary to complete the psychiatric examination ordered by this
court, It is hereby
ORDERED, that the Commissioner of Mental

Health is authorized to continue confinement of the above-named defendant in a
secure facility pursuant to the aforesaid examination order for an additional
period not exceeding 30 days. Dated: ________
____________
Justice of the Supreme Court

Judge of the County Court
